title: Remove Admin Setup link from navbar at specified XPath location

requirements.summary: Remove the 'Admin Setup' navigation link from the Navbar component, ensuring no 'Admin Setup' or 'Register Admin' link appears in the navigation menu for any user
acceptanceCriteria: The 'Admin Setup' link is completely removed from the navigation section at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/nav[1]/div[1]/div[2]
No 'Admin Setup' or 'Register Admin' link appears in the Navbar for any user role
The navigation menu displays only Home, Dashboard, and Admin (for admin users) links
The removal is permanent and does not conditionally re-appear based on authentication or role state

file_operations.description: Remove the 'Admin Setup' navigation link and all related conditional rendering logic from the Navbar component. Based on the file summary, this component contains an Admin Setup link for non-admin users that needs to be completely removed. Delete any JSX elements, state checks, or conditional rendering blocks that display the 'Admin Setup' or 'Register Admin' link in the navigation menu. Ensure that only Home, Dashboard, and Admin (for admin users) links remain visible in the navigation bar. Verify that the removal does not affect other navigation links or the responsive mobile menu functionality.

requirements.summary: Verify that the admin registration functionality at route '/admin/register' remains accessible through direct URL navigation even though the navigation link is removed
acceptanceCriteria: The AdminRegistration page component remains functional at '/admin/register' route
Users can access the admin registration page by typing the URL directly
The admin registration form and functionality work correctly when accessed via direct URL
Only the navigation link is removed, not the underlying functionality

file_operations.description: Add a verification comment at the top of the AdminRegistration component confirming that this page remains fully functional and accessible via direct URL navigation at '/admin/register'. No functional changes are needed - this operation documents that the component continues to work independently of navigation link visibility. The page should continue to handle admin registration with all existing validation, authentication checks, and user interface elements intact.
